intro: Chromolaena bigelovii, commonly known as wild hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate, with a rough texture and prominent veins. Chromolaena bigelovii is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and abandoned fields.
